title: 2025_German_federal_election
summary: This article summarizes the results of the 2025 German federal election held on February 23, 2025, showing the CDU/CSU winning the most seats (208) while the AfD gained significant ground with 152 seats and the SPD suffered major losses. The election saw a high turnout of 82.5% and resulted in significant shifts in the German political landscape, with traditional parties like the FDP losing all their parliamentary representation.
extract: Federal elections were held in Germany on 23 February 2025 to elect the 630 members of the 21st Bundestag. It was the fourth snap election in the history of the post-war Federal Republic of Germany after those in 1972, 1983, and 2005.

title: Virat_Kohli
summary: This article is a professional cricketer profile for Virat Kohli, an Indian cricket star born in 1988. It details his career statistics across Test, ODI, and T20I formats, highlighting his achievements including World Cup victories, batting records, and his nickname "King Kohli."
extract: Virat Kohli is an Indian international cricketer who plays Test and ODI cricket for the national team and is a former captain in all formats. He is a right-handed batsman and an occasional right arm medium pace bowler. He is called the king and the chase master for his playing style, skill and records. Kohli is the highest run-scorer in the Indian Premier League, third in T20I, third in ODI, and third in international cricket. Regarded as one of the greatest batsmen of all time, he holds the record for the most ODI centuries and has the second most centuries in international cricket.

title: Keenen_Ivory_Wayans
summary: This article provides a biographical overview of Keenen Ivory Wayans, an American actor, comedian, and filmmaker known for creating the Fox sketch comedy series "In Living Color" and directing successful films like "Scary Movie." The text highlights his career achievements, family connections within the entertainment industry, and his status as a pioneering African American director.
extract: Keenen Ivory Desuma Wayans is an American actor, comedian, director and filmmaker. He is a member of the Wayans family of entertainers. Wayans first came to prominence as the host and creator of the 1990–1994 Fox sketch comedy series In Living Color. He has produced, directed or written several films, starting with Hollywood Shuffle, which he cowrote, in 1987. Most of his films have included him and one or more of his siblings in the cast.

title: Alternative_for_Germany
summary: The article is about Alternative for Germany (AfD), a far-right political party in Germany founded in 2013. The party, led by co-leaders Tino Chrupalla and Alice Weidel, is characterized by right-wing populism, national conservatism, and Euroscepticism, with representation in the Bundestag, state parliaments, and European Parliament.
extract: Alternative for Germany is a far-right, right-wing populist, and nativist political party in Germany. The AfD is Eurosceptic, and opposes immigration into Germany, especially Muslim immigration. The name of the party reflects its resistance to policies of Angela Merkel with her insistence on Alternativlosigkeit. The Federal Office for the Protection of the Constitution, Germany's domestic intelligence agency, has classified the party as a "suspected extremist" organisation.
anthropic_trending_reason: Alternative for Germany is trending because it achieved unprecedented electoral success in Germany's recent national election, becoming the strongest far-right party since World War II. The party has risen to become Germany's second-strongest political force despite being classified as a "suspected extremist" organization, with particular attention on its growing support among young voters and its provocative messaging.
openai_trending_reason: Alternative_for_Germany is trending because it has recently surged in support during elections, achieving the best showing for a far-right party in Germany since World War II. This rise is particularly notable among young voters, reflecting a growing discontent with traditional political parties and increasing support for the party's nativist and Eurosceptic positions.

title: Friedrich_Merz
summary: This article is about Friedrich Merz, a German politician who has been serving as the Leader of the Christian Democratic Union (CDU) since January 2022 and as the Leader of the Opposition in the German Bundestag since February 2022. It notes that in September 2024, Merz became the CDU/CSU Union's candidate for Chancellor of Germany in the upcoming 2025 federal election.
extract: Joachim-Friedrich Martin Josef Merz is a German politician who has served as Leader of the Christian Democratic Union (CDU) since January 2022 and led the CDU/CSU (Union) parliamentary group as well as being Leader of the Opposition in the Bundestag since February 2022. In September 2024, he became the Union's candidate for Chancellor of Germany ahead of the 2025 federal election. With the CDU winning the most seats in the 2025 German federal election, Merz is projected to become the next Chancellor of Germany.

title: Alice_Weidel
summary: This article provides an overview of Alice Weidel, a German politician born in 1979 who currently serves as co-chairwoman of the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) party alongside Tino Chrupalla since June 2022. She has been the leader of the AfD parliamentary group in the Bundestag since October 2017, having first entered parliament in the 2017 federal election as a lead candidate and again in the 2021 election.
extract: Alice Elisabeth Weidel is a German politician who has been serving as co-chairwoman of the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) party alongside Tino Chrupalla since June 2022. Since October 2017, she has held the position of leader of the AfD parliamentary group in the Bundestag.

title: 2021_German_federal_election
summary: The article covers the 2021 German federal election, which took place on September 26, 2021, resulting in a victory for Olaf Scholz's Social Democratic Party (SPD) with 25.7% of the vote and 206 seats in the Bundestag. Following the election, a "traffic light coalition" government was formed between the SPD, Greens, and FDP, replacing Angela Merkel's previous CDU/CSU-SPD grand coalition.
extract: Federal elections were held in Germany on 26 September 2021 to elect the members of the 20th Bundestag. State elections in Berlin and Mecklenburg-Vorpommern were also held. Incumbent chancellor Angela Merkel, first elected in 2005, chose not to run again, marking the first time that an incumbent Chancellor of the Federal Republic of Germany did not seek re-election.

title: CDU/CSU
summary: This article discusses the CDU/CSU, a centre-right political alliance in Germany comprising two parties: the Christian Democratic Union (CDU) and the Christian Social Union in Bavaria (CSU). It explains how these "Union parties" function as sister parties with the CSU operating only in Bavaria while the CDU contests elections in Germany's other 15 states, sharing a common parliamentary group in the Bundestag since 1949 despite maintaining their independence.
extract: CDU/CSU, unofficially the Union parties or the Union, is a centre-right Christian democratic and conservative political alliance of two political parties in Germany: the Christian Democratic Union of Germany (CDU) and the Christian Social Union in Bavaria (CSU).

title: UFC_Fight_Night:_Cejudo_vs._Song
summary: This article provides details about UFC Fight Night 252, a mixed martial arts event held on February 22, 2025, at Climate Pledge Arena in Seattle, featuring a bantamweight main event between former two-division champion Henry Cejudo and Song Yadong. The article outlines the event's background, attendance figures, and several fight card changes that occurred leading up to the promotion's return to Seattle for the first time since 2013.
normalized_title: UFC Fight Night: Cejudo vs. Song
extract: UFC Fight Night: Cejudo vs. Song was a mixed martial arts event produced by the Ultimate Fighting Championship that took place on February 22, 2025, at the Climate Pledge Arena in Seattle, Washington, United States.
text:
{{Short description|Mixed martial arts event in 2025}}
{{Infobox MMA event
|name= UFC Fight Night: Cejudo vs. Song
|image= UFC Fight Night 252.jpg
|promotion= [[Ultimate Fighting Championship]]
|date= {{start date|2025|2|22}}
|venue=[[Climate Pledge Arena]]
|city= [[Seattle, Washington]], United States 
|attendance= 18,287<ref name="attn&gate">{{Cite web|url=https://mmajunkie.usatoday.com/lists/ufc-fight-night-252-post-event-facts-anthony-hernandez-breaks-takedown-record|title=UFC Fight Night 252 post-event facts: Anthony Hernandez breaks Chris Weidman's takedown record|publisher=mmajunkie.usatoday.com|author=Mike Bohn|date=2025-02-23|access-date=2025-02-23}}</ref>
|gate= $3,841,751.94<ref name="attn&gate"/>
|previousevent= [[UFC Fight Night: Cannonier vs. Rodrigues]]
|followingevent= [[UFC Fight Night: Kape vs. Almabayev]]
}}

'''''UFC Fight Night: Cejudo vs. Song''''' (also known as '''''UFC Fight Night 252''''' and '''''UFC on ESPN+ 110''''') was a mixed martial arts event produced by the [[Ultimate Fighting Championship]] that took place on February 22, 2025, at the [[Climate Pledge Arena]] in [[Seattle, Washington]], United States.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://mmajunkie.usatoday.com/lists/ufc-announces-2025-schedule-new-events-location-dates|title=UFC announces 2025 schedule including slew of new events|publisher=mmajunkie.usatoday.com|author=Nolan King|date=2024-11-16|access-date=2024-11-16}}</ref>

==Background==
The event marked the promotion's fourth visit to Seattle and first since [[UFC on Fox: Johnson vs. Moraga]] in July 2013.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://mmajunkie.usatoday.com/2024/12/ufc-seattle-fight-card-february-22-2025-climate-pledge-arena|title=UFC makes Seattle return official for early 2025|publisher=mmajunkie.usatoday.com|author=Nolan King|date=2024-12-07|access-date=2024-12-07}}</ref>

A bantamweight bout between former [[UFC Flyweight Championship|UFC Flyweight]] and [[UFC Bantamweight Championship|Bantamweight Champion]] (also [[Wrestling at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's freestyle 55 kg|2008 Olympic gold medalist in freestyle wrestling]]) [[Henry Cejudo]] and [[Song Yadong]] headlined the event.<ref>{{Cite web|author=Harvey Leonard|date=2025-01-06|title=Henry Cejudo vs. Song Yadong headlines UFC Seattle, Dominick Cruz returns in co-main event|url=https://www.mmanews.com/news/ufc/cejudo-song-yadong-ufc-seattle-dom-cruz/|access-date=2025-01-06|publisher=mmanews.com}}</ref>

A women's bantamweight bout between [[Ketlen Vieira]] and [[The Ultimate Fighter: Heavy Hitters]] women's featherweight winner [[Macy Chiasson]] was expected to take place at the event.<ref>{{Cite web|publisher=sherdog.com|title=Macy Chiasson vs. Ketlen Vieira set for UFC event on Feb. 22|url=https://www.sherdog.com/news/news/Macy-Chiasson-vs-Ketlen-Vieira-Set-for-UFC-Event-on-Feb-22-195402|date=2024-11-05|access-date=2024-11-06|author=Tristen Critchfield}}</ref> However, due to an injury suffered by Chiasson, the bout was removed from the card.<ref name="Feb13update">{{Cite web|url=https://www.sherdog.com/news/news/UFC-Seattle-Lineup-Shifts-Due-to-Injury-New-Added-Matches-196154|title=UPDATED UFC Seattle Lineup Shifts Due to Injury, New Added Matches|publisher=sherdog.com|author=Jay Pettry|date=2024-12-13|access-date=2025-02-13}}</ref> The pair was previously scheduled for [[UFC Fight Night: Ankalaev vs. Walker 2]] in January 2024, but Vieira was pulled as a result of an injury and the bout was scrapped.<ref>{{Cite web|author=Jay Anderson|date=2023-12-30|title=Loss of Macy Chiasson vs. Ketlen Vieira among hits to UFC Vegas 84|url=https://cagesidepress.com/2023/12/30/loss-macy-chiasson-ketlen-vieira-ufc-vegas-84/|access-date=2024-06-17|publisher=cagesidepress.com}}</ref>

A middleweight bout between Mansur Abdul-Malik and Antonio Trócoli was scheduled for this event.<ref>{{Cite web|date=2025-01-03|title=UFC Seattle adds Mansur Abdul-Malik vs. Antonio Trocoli|url=https://mmajunkie.usatoday.com/2025/01/ufc-seattle-adds-mansur-abdul-malik-vs-antonio-trocoli|access-date=2025-01-25|publisher=mmajunkie.usatoday.com|author=Nolan King}}</ref> However, Trócoli withdrew for undisclosed reasons and was replaced by Nick Klein.<ref name="Klein">{{Cite web|date=2025-01-25|title=Nick Klein steps into short-notice debut at UFC Fight Night 252 vs. Mansur Abdul-Malik|url=https://mmajunkie.usatoday.com/2025/01/ufc-seattle-nick-klein-vs-mansur-abdul-malik|access-date=2025-01-25|publisher=mmajunkie.usatoday.com|author=Nolan King}}</ref>

A welterweight bout between promotional newcomer [[Islam Dulatov]] and Adam Fugitt was scheduled for this event.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://cagesidepress.com/2024/12/03/adam-fugitt-vs-islam-dulatov-lands-on-ufc-seattle/|title=Adam Fugitt vs. Islam Dulatov lands on UFC Seattle|publisher=cagesidepress.com|author=Jay Anderson|date=2024-12-03|access-date=2025-01-28}}</ref> However, Dulatov withdrew from the fight due to an undisclosed injury and was replaced by Billy Goff.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://cagesi

The event is generating significant media attention with multiple outlets covering fight predictions, streaming options, and analysis ahead of its February 22, 2025 date at Seattle's Climate Pledge Arena.
